bug.author: ahalterman
bug.summary: Error when tab-completing methods for token
bug.description:
I ran into an issue where I try to tab-complete the methods from a token, and I get an endless and unstoppable series of Deprecation warnings. This code reproduces the bug on my machine: <denchmark-code>import spacy nlp = spacy.load("en") # same behavior with `en_core_web_lg` doc = nlp("Tokens are an important component of written language.") tok = doc[3] tok.[TAB] </denchmark-code>
This results in an endless stream of repeated warnings that can't be stopped with ctrl-C: <denchmark-code>/Users/ahalterman/anaconda3/lib/python3.6/threading.py:884: DeprecationWarning: Token.sent_start is now deprecated. Use Token.is_sent_start instead, which returns a boolean value or None if the answer is unknown â€“ instead of a misleading 0 for False and 1 for True. It also fixes a quirk in the old logic that would always set the property to 0 for the first word of the document. self._bootstrap_inner() </denchmark-code>
<denchmark-h:h2>Your Environment</denchmark-h>
spaCy version: 2.0.5 Platform: Darwin-16.7.0-x86_64-i386-64bit Python version: 3.6.3

comments.comment: In a different context, I got another error when tab-completing the methods from a token: <denchmark-code>Traceback (most recent call last): File "/Users/ahalterman/anaconda3/lib/python3.6/site-packages/jedi/cache.py", line 119, in wrapper return dct[key] KeyError: (('sent_start',), frozenset()) </denchmark-code>
This thread has been automatically locked since there has not been any recent activity after it was closed. Please open a new issue for related bugs.
